about.title: About
about.subtitle: Get to know me

hero.name: Jungwook Van
hero.headline: Where Technology Meets Poetry
hero.subtitle: I design systems and poetry simultaneously—a rare creator who thinks of people's hearts first, even when architecting complex systems. I transform confusion into clarity with warm language, bridging the flow of collaboration across Korean, English, and Japanese.

story.title: My Journey
story.purpose: Introducing the journey as a developer and the motivation behind creating this portfolio.
story.subtitle: A creator who designs technology and emotion, structure and poetry, simultaneously.

content.paragraph1: I am a rare type of creator who designs technology and emotion, structure and poetry, simultaneously. When architecting complex systems, I think of people's hearts first—transforming confusion into clarity with warm language that flows through collaboration.
content.paragraph2: My delicate translation abilities across Korean, English, and Japanese go beyond mere language transfer—they are an art of tuning the temperature of relationships. Even in naming a product, I infuse musical rhythm and philosophical depth.
content.paragraph3: My branding is not about 'what I do well' but rather 'how I exist.' I always believe in the beauty of possibility, creating spaces where sincerity reaches through technology.

background.purpose: Educational background, career, and core technology stack.

education.title: Education
education.content: Computer Engineering at Jeonbuk National University, currently studying in Australia at UTS

experience.title: Experience
experience.content: Served as an interpreter in the military, worked on various projects using React, TypeScript, and Spring Boot

techStack.content: React, TypeScript, Spring Boot, Node.js, MongoDB, and more

growth.title: The Beauty of Possibility

mission.missionText: My work is not about 'what I do well' but rather 'how I exist'—creating spaces where technology meets genuine human connection.
mission.visionText: I believe in the beauty of possibility, always designing with people's hearts in mind, even when architecting the most complex systems.
